verses.verse: Behold, thou art fair <S%H3303><s%>, my love <S%H7474><s%>; behold, thou art fair <S%H3303><s%>; thou hast doves <S%H3123><s%> ' eyes <S%H5869><s%> within <S%H1157><s%> thy locks <S%H6777><s%>: thy hair <S%H8181><s%> is as a flock <S%H5739><s%> of goats <S%H5795><s%>, that appear <S%H1570><s%> from mount <S%H2022><s%> Gil`ad <S%H1568><s%>.

Thy teeth <S%H8127><s%> are like a flock <S%H5739><s%> of sheep that are even sshofar <S%H7094><s%> <S%H8803><s%>, which came up <S%H5927><s%> <S%H8804><s%> from the washing <S%H7367><s%>; whereof every one bear twins <S%H8382><s%> <S%H8688><s%>, and none is barren <S%H7909><s%> among them.

Thy lips <S%H8193><s%> are like a thread <S%H2339><s%> of scarlet <S%H8144><s%>, and thy speech <S%H4057><s%> is comely <S%H5000><s%>: thy temples <S%H7541><s%> are like a piece <S%H6400><s%> of a pomegranate <S%H7416><s%> within <S%H1157><s%> thy locks <S%H6777><s%>.

Thy neck <S%H6677><s%> is like the tower <S%H4026><s%> of David <S%H1732><s%> builded <S%H1129><s%> <S%H8803><s%> for an armoury <S%H8530><s%>, whereon there hang <S%H8518><s%> <S%H8803><s%> a thousand <S%H505><s%> bucklers <S%H4043><s%>, all shields <S%H7982><s%> of mighty men <S%H1368><s%>.

Thy two <S%H8147><s%> breasts <S%H7699><s%> are like two <S%H8147><s%> young <S%H6082><s%> roes <S%H6646><s%> that are twins <S%H8380><s%>, which feed <S%H7462><s%> <S%H8802><s%> among the lilies <S%H7799><s%>.

Until the day <S%H3117><s%> break <S%H6315><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, and the shadows <S%H6752><s%> flee away <S%H5127><s%> <S%H8804><s%>, I will get <S%H3212><s%> <S%H8799><s%> me to the mountain <S%H2022><s%> of myrrh <S%H4753><s%>, and to the hill <S%H1389><s%> of frankincense <S%H3828><s%>.
Thou art all fair <S%H3303><s%>, my love <S%H7474><s%>; there is no spot <S%H3971><s%> in thee.

Come <S%H935><s%> <S%H8799><s%> with me from Lebanon <S%H3844><s%>, my spouse <S%H3618><s%>, with me from Lebanon <S%H3844><s%>: look <S%H7789><s%> <S%H8799><s%> from the top <S%H7218><s%> of Amana <S%H549><s%>, from the top <S%H7218><s%> of Shenir <S%H8149><s%> and Hermon <S%H2768><s%>, from the lions <S%H738><s%> ' dens <S%H4585><s%>, from the mountains <S%H2042><s%> of the leopards <S%H5246><s%>.

Thou hast ravished my heart <S%H3823><s%> <S%H8765><s%>, my sister <S%H269><s%>, my spouse <S%H3618><s%>; thou hast ravished my heart <S%H3823><s%> <S%H8765><s%> with one <S%H259><s%> of thine eyes <S%H5869><s%>, with one <S%H259><s%> chain <S%H6060><s%> of thy neck <S%H6677><s%>.

How fair <S%H3302><s%> <S%H8804><s%> is thy love <S%H1730><s%>, my sister <S%H269><s%>, my spouse <S%H3618><s%> ! how much better <S%H2895><s%> <S%H8804><s%> is thy love <S%H1730><s%> than wine <S%H3196><s%> ! and the smell <S%H7381><s%> of thine ointments <S%H8081><s%> than all spices <S%H1314><s%> !

Thy lips <S%H8193><s%>, O my spouse <S%H3618><s%>, drop <S%H5197><s%> <S%H8799><s%> as the honeycomb <S%H5317><s%>: honey <S%H1706><s%> and milk <S%H2461><s%> are under thy tongue <S%H3956><s%>; and the smell <S%H7381><s%> of thy garments <S%H8008><s%> is like the smell <S%H7381><s%> of Lebanon <S%H3844><s%>.

A garden <S%H1588><s%> inclosed <S%H5274><s%> <S%H8803><s%> is my sister <S%H269><s%>, my spouse <S%H3618><s%>; a spring <S%H1530><s%> shut up <S%H5274><s%> <S%H8803><s%>, a fountain <S%H4599><s%> sealed <S%H2856><s%> <S%H8803><s%>.
Thy plants <S%H7973><s%> are an orchard <S%H6508><s%> of pomegranates <S%H7416><s%>, with pleasant <S%H4022><s%> fruits <S%H6529><s%>; camphire <S%H3724><s%>, with spikenard <S%H5373><s%>,

Spikenard <S%H5373><s%> and saffron <S%H3750><s%>; calamus <S%H7070><s%> and cinnamon <S%H7076><s%>, with all trees <S%H6086><s%> of frankincense <S%H3828><s%>; myrrh <S%H4753><s%> and aloes <S%H174><s%>, with all the chief <S%H7218><s%> spices <S%H1314><s%>:
A fountain <S%H4599><s%> of gardens <S%H1588><s%>, a well <S%H875><s%> of living <S%H2416><s%> waters <S%H4325><s%>, and streams <S%H5140><s%> <S%H8802><s%> from Lebanon <S%H3844><s%>.

Awake <S%H5782><s%> <S%H8798><s%>, O north wind <S%H6828><s%>; and come <S%H935><s%> <S%H8798><s%>, thou south <S%H8486><s%>; blow <S%H6315><s%> <S%H8685><s%> upon my garden <S%H1588><s%>, that the spices <S%H1314><s%> thereof may flow out <S%H5140><s%> <S%H8799><s%>. Let my beloved <S%H1730><s%> come <S%H935><s%> <S%H8799><s%> into his garden <S%H1588><s%>, and eat <S%H398><s%> <S%H8799><s%> his pleasant <S%H4022><s%> fruits <S%H6529><s%>.
